discourse_list.title: Participate in OP Token House Governance on Tally

content.content: With the Bedrock vote beginning soon, I want to make everyone aware that Optimism Token House governance is live on Tally! You can use Tally to:  Research Token House delegates Delegate the voting power of your OP tokens Monitor the progress of governance proposals & analyze voting results Vote on governance proposals  Tally is the most popular user interface for on-chain governance. We are the preferred on-chain governance solution for many of the large DAOs within the Ethereum ecosystem such as Uniswap, Gitcoin, ENS, Compound, and Hop. I included a few screenshots below to give you a sense of what you can expect from Tally’s user interface.  Screenshot 2023-02-15 at 10.31.58 PM1606×1220 112 KB   Screenshot 2023-02-15 at 10.32.26 PM1760×1628 421 KB   Screenshot 2023-02-15 at 10.32.50 PM1608×1440 436 KB  To participate in Optimism Token House governance, visit Tally | Optimism. To learn more about Tally, visit https://docs.tally.xyz/. Please feel free to reach out to me on Discord (Frisson#0409) if you have any questions about how to use Tally for OP Token House Governance. Cheers, Frisson Head of Marketing, Tally
content.GPT-summary: The post is an advertisement for Optimism Token House governance on Tally, a user interface for on-chain governance. The author provides information on how to use Tally to participate in governance, including researching delegates, delegating voting power, monitoring proposals, and voting. The author also invites readers to reach out with any questions about using Tally for OP Token House Governance.

content.content: Great post @Frisson Tally is an awesome protocol for on-chain governance! I’m glad to see Optimism support! It would be interesting if OP Grant council had to use a Tally time lock contract to distribute OP via on-chain voting between sub-committee members. just a thought. Anyway great to see Tally contribute to Optimism governance!
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: Thanks for your reply @Butterbum! We would love to support on-chain governance for the OP Grant Council. Happy to chat more about how this could be accomplished. First step would probably be to fund seasons via an on-chain proposal from the Token House. From there, it could make sense to deploy the Grant Council as a sub-DAO and execute individual grants as on-chain proposals as well. It would bring a lot of additional transparency and security to the process. Cheers!
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party or author wants to collaborate on proposal
